intro: Brachystephanus occidentalis, commonly known as the western stephanus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
